newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Cetes rate edges down at close.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Cetes rate edges down at close.

text.p: Mexican overnight Cetes rates closed down 20 basis points at 21.20 percent on Thursday after what traders described as a quiet day in which trading rates were very stable.
"It was a very quiet session. Bid-offer spreads stayed very tight so trading rates barely moved," one trader said.
Overnight government rates ranged between 21.20/21.50 percent, and traders situated the average trading rate at 21.40 percent.
Overnight rates on bank paper meanwhile closed down 15 basis points at 22.75 percent.
Dealers noted that liquidity during the session was adequate, and that Banco de Mexico needed to inject a relatively light 123 million pesos, by assigning an overnight loan at 22.63 percent.
Liquidity of 772 million pesos was scheduled to return to the system on Friday.
